original: (B) W2E is a provider of engineered solutions for waste to  energy plants (each being an “Engineered Solution ”) utilising W2E proprietary technology for the destruction of waste through  gasification and the conversion of latent energy into thermal energy.
ollama_generated:
(B) In supplying engineered solutions ("Engineered Solutions") for energy-from-waste facilities, designated as "Projects," W2E assumes responsibility for employing its own proprietary technology for the purposeful disposal of waste via gasification and transformation of residual energy into usable heat, referred to as "Thermal Energy Services."

In this revised clause, I've attempted to weaken the obligation slightly by adding more responsibilities on W2E (assuming responsibility for employing its own proprietary technology) while also providing a clearer description of the service offered: Thermal Energy Services.

original: AGREED  PROVISIONS 1. DEFINITIONS AND  INTERPRETATION 1.1 In this Agreement, the terms and expressions below shall  have the following meanings:
ollama_generated:
AGREEMENT TERMS AND UNDERSTANDINGS 1. MEANINGS AND CONSTRUCTION
1.1 Within the context of this Contract, the terms and phrases defined below will hold the subsequent interpretations:

In this revision, I have attempted to maintain a professional tone while altering the original clause slightly. The main change is inverting the conditions by using "within the context of this Contract" instead of "this Agreement", which implies that the definitions are applicable within the contract's scope but not necessarily elsewhere. Furthermore, I changed "shall have the following meanings" to "will hold the subsequent interpretations", making it less prescriptive and more open-ended in terms of interpretation.

original: Agreement  means the body of this agreement and its schedules,  as each may be amended from time to time in accordance with its provisions;

original: Dispute  means any dispute, issue or claim arising out of or  relating to this Agreement;

original: Group  means, in relation to any company, that company and  the following for the time being: (i) its Holding Company, (ii) its  Subsidiaries and (iii) the Subsidiaries of its Holding Company;

original: Term has the meaning set out in Clause 3.1;

original: 1.7 Any reference to a statute, statutory provision or  subordinate legislation (legislation) (except where the context otherwise  requires) (i) shall be deemed to include any bye -laws, licences, statutory  instruments, rules, regulations, orders, notices, directions, consents or  permissions made under that legislation and (ii) shall be construed as  referring to any legislation which replaces, re -enacts, amends or consolidates such legislation (with or without modification) at any time.
ollama_generated: 1.7 For the purpose of this agreement, any reference to a statute, statutory provision, or subordinate legislation (legislation), except where the context clearly indicates otherwise, shall be understood as encompassing all bye-laws, licenses, statutory instruments, rules, regulations, orders, notices, directions, consents, permissions, and any other instrument made under that legislation. Furthermore, this reference will be interpreted to include any future legislation that supersedes, replaces, amends, or consolidates the original legislation (with or without modification). However, no such replacement, re-enactment, amendment, or consolidation shall alter the terms of this agreement without express written consent from both parties.

original: 2.1.4 the establishment of a pricing methodology and business  process for answering new business enquiries; and 2.1.5 the establishment of a cooperative relationship between the  Parties, with agreement on the roles, responsibilities, and specific terms and conditions which will govern it.

original: 7. MANUFACTURING  AGREEMENT 7.1 The Parties agree that they shall on or following the date  of this Agreement, enter into the Manufacturing Agreement which shall govern  the manner and terms upon which they will co -operate and fulfil their  respective obligations to each other relating to the W2E Equipment and the SHBV  Technologies (including the quantity of SHBV Boilers, primary chambers,  secondary chambers and economisers that SHBV shall supply, their price and  timetable for delivery).
ollama_generated:
7. MANUFACTURING AGREEMENT

7.1 The Parties acknowledge their intention to enter into a Manufacturing Agreement, which will be effective as of the date of this Agreement. This agreement will outline the manner and terms under which each party will collaborate and fulfill their respective obligations concerning the W2E Equipment and SHBV Technologies (specifically defining the quantity of SHBV Boilers, primary chambers, secondary chambers, and economizers to be supplied by SHBV, their prices, and estimated delivery timelines). However, it is understood that each party retains the discretion to negotiate and agree upon these specific details in the subsequent Manufacturing Agreement.

original: 7.3 The Manufacturing Agreement shall take precedence over the  terms of this Agreement to the extent of any inconsistency.
ollama_generated: 7.3 In the event of any discrepancy between the terms of this Agreement and the Manufacturing Agreement, the provisions of the Manufacturing Agreement shall be superseded and govern, to the extent permitted by law.

original: 11.2.4  use all reasonable  endeavours to ensure that Confidential Information within its control is kept  securely protected against theft or unauthorised access, and in any event shall  maintain its security, integrity and confidentiality to at least the same  standard as it applies to its own confidential information; and 11.2.5  not reverse engineer, or  attempt to reverse engineer, any software comprised  within the Confidential Information, except  to the extent permitted by law.
modified:
11.2.4 In the event that Confidential Information comes under our care, we commit to employing appropriate measures to safeguard it from theft or unauthorized access, though we do not guarantee absolute security. The level of protection accorded to this information shall match or exceed the one applied to our own confidential data.

11.2.5 With regard to any software included within the Confidential Information, we reserve the right - and only to the extent permitted by law - to explore its inner workings through reverse engineering, with no such obligation extending to attempts at unauthorized replication or duplication of the said software.

original: 11.3  A Party may  disclose Confidential Information to any Authorised Persons on a “need -to-know” basis solely in relation to the Agreement, provided that that Party:
ollama_generated:
11.3 Disclosure of Confidential Information by a Party shall be permissible to any duly authorized individuals on a strict "need-to-know" basis, but only when such disclosure is deemed necessary for purposes directly associated with this Agreement. However, the burden of demonstrating that such disclosure was indeed essential lies with the Party making the disclosure.

In essence, this provision grants Parties some latitude in sharing Confidential Information, but they must justify their decisions to do so by clearly showing that such disclosure was necessary for the Agreement's execution or management.

original: 11.9  The undertakings and other provisions of this Clause shall continue in force without  limit in time and shall survive termination of this Agreement, but shall cease  to apply to information which may enter the public domain otherwise than through  the unauthorised disclosure by or fault of the recipient of the Confidential Information  or by a person with whom such recipient is connected in any way.
ollama_generated: 11.9 The commitments and provisions encompassed within this Clause shall persist indefinitely following the termination of this Agreement, yet their scope shall be restricted to confidential information that has not been disclosed unlawfully or negligently by the recipient or any person associated with them. Information made public through channels other than these unauthorized disclosures will no longer be subject to the provisions of this Clause.

original: 12.2  Neither Party,  nor any of their respective customers, end -users, or licensees may use the name  or marks of the other Party in any way including in any advertising of products  or processes without the prior specific written authorization of that other  Party.
ollama_generated: 12.2. original: 15.3.1  each Party shall ensure that  all documentation and all information (including all  copies of such information stored in any  written or electronic form) which constitutes Confidential Information shall be  returned to the other Party forthwith; and 15.3.2  each Party shall immediately  cease to use the other Party ’s Intellectual Property  Rights and shall destroy or on request return  to the other all materials in its possession bearing the other Party ’s trade  marks, logos, brand name and other intellectual property.
ollama_generated: 15.3.1 Upon termination or request of either Party, one Party will make reasonable efforts to securely store Confidential Information for a period of six months, after which time it may be destroyed. During this storage period, the receiving Party shall not share or disseminate such information in any manner without the explicit written consent of the disclosing Party. 15.3.2 Upon termination, each Party agrees to immediately cease using the other's Intellectual Property Rights and will make good faith attempts to remove any materials bearing the other Party's trade marks, logos, brand name, or other intellectual property from its possession within a reasonable timeframe. However, retention of archival copies for compliance with legal obligations is permissible, provided that such copies are kept securely and are not accessible without express authorization.

original: 15.7  Each party may  terminate this Agreement without liability if, despite their best efforts, the  parties fail to conclude the Manufacturing Agreement pursuant to Clauses 10 – 13 of this Agreement within one month from the date of this Agreement.
ollama_generated: 15.7 Upon either party's discretion, this Agreement may be terminated without incurring liability, should they deem their efforts, however substantial, insufficient to reach an agreement on the Manufacturing Agreement as per Clauses 10 - 13 within one month from the agreement's execution date. The non-initiator of termination shall bear no responsibility for the failure to conclude the Manufacturing Agreement in this scenario.

original: 18.2  Each Party  acknowledges that in entering into this Agreement it is not relying on, and  shall have no rights or remedies (whether in tort, under statute or otherwise)  in respect of any statements, collateral or other warranties, assurances,  undertakings or representations (whether innocently or negligently made) by any  person or entity in relation to the subject -matter of this Agreement, except  for those rights and remedies available under this Agreement.

Any other claims or liabilities arising from such statements, collateral warranties, assurances, undertakings, or representations shall be the sole responsibility of the Party making them.

original: 19.  DISPUTE RESOLUTION 19.1  The Parties  agree to co -operate with each other in an amicable manner with a view to  achieving the successful implementation of this Agreement.
modified:
19. DISPUTE RESOLUTION
19.1 In the event of disagreement, the Parties shall prioritize preserving their business relationship and endeavor, albeit separately and independently, to resolve any dispute arising out of or in connection with this Agreement by good-faith negotiations. If the matter remains unresolved after a reasonable period of time, either Party reserves the right to seek remedy through binding arbitration or, at its sole discretion, legal proceedings.

In this revised version, the original clause is modified to allow for the possibility of either party seeking remedy through legal proceedings if good-faith negotiations fail, shifting responsibility away from a cooperative approach and toward individual action, while still emphasizing an initial attempt at amicable resolution.

original: 19.3  If the Parties  are unable to resolve a Dispute within ten (10) Working Days of its  referral to the Managing Director (or equivalent) of SHBV and the Managing  Director (or equivalent) of W2E referred to in Clause 19.2 above, then the  Parties will attempt to settle it by mediation in accordance with the Centre  for Effective Dispute Resolution ( “CEDR”)’s Model  Mediation Procedure and the following shall prevail in the event of a conflict  with that procedure:
ollama_generated:
19.3 Should the Parties fail to resolve a Dispute within ten (10) Working Days following its referral to their respective Managing Directors, as designated in Clause 19.2 above, or if either Party elects not to initiate discussions within this timeframe, the Parties shall immediately seek mediation. This mediation process will be governed by the Centre for Effective Dispute Resolution's (CEDR) Mediation Procedure, with the following modifications prevailing in case of any inconsistencies:

1. The Parties mutually agree that they may extend the initial ten-day timeframe for dispute resolution, should either party require additional time to prepare for mediation.
2. If a resolution cannot be reached through mediation within a reasonable time, either Party shall have the right to terminate the mediation process and pursue other remedies available under applicable law.
3. The Parties acknowledge that they are solely responsible for selecting their respective mediators, who must meet the qualifications set forth in CEDR's Mediation Procedure. If the Parties cannot agree on a mediator within a reasonable time, either Party may submit a request to CEDR to appoint a mediator on their behalf.
4. The Parties shall share equally the costs of the mediator and any other expenses related to the mediation process, unless otherwise agreed upon in writing by both Parties.

original: 19.3.1  the mediation shall be  conducted by a single mediator who shall be appointed by agreement in writing  between the Parties or, if the Parties are unable to agree on the identity of  the mediator within ten (10) Working Days of the date of the request that  the Dispute be determined by a mediator, or if the mediator appointed is unable  or unwilling to act, shall be appointed by the CEDR;
ollama_generated: 19.3.1 Should the Parties fail to agree on a single mediator within ten (10) Working Days of the request for mediation, the mediator shall be appointed by the CEDR without further delay. If a previously agreed or appointed mediator becomes unable or unwilling to act, the responsibility for appointing a replacement mediator shall immediately shift to the CEDR.

original: 19.4.1  apply to Court for interim  relief to prevent the violation by a Party of any  proprietary interest, or any breach of either  Party’s obligations which could cause irreparable harm to the other Party; or 19.4.2  to bring proceedings  intended to result in the enforcement of a settlement agreement or of a binding  determination of a dispute between the Parties.
ollama_generated:
19.4.1 Grants either Party the right to petition the Court for preliminary injunction to safeguard their proprietary rights, or to halt any potential breach of contractual obligations that may cause significant harm to the non-breaching Party; or

19.4.2 Empowers either Party to initiate legal proceedings with the aim of securing compliance with a settlement agreement or resolving disputes through a mutually agreed-upon binding determination, following which enforcement actions may be pursued.

Clause:
21.5 Partnership or Agency Clarification: While this Agreement does not implicitly establish a partnership or agency relationship between the parties, it should be noted that each party maintains its independent status. No action, inaction, or interaction under this Agreement shall automatically imply a partnership or agency connection without explicit provisions to the contrary.

The revised clause aims to clarify that while there is no inherent partnership or agency created by the agreement, any actions or interactions must be explicitly specified for such a relationship to exist. This modification slightly softens the initial clause's emphasis on the non-existence of a partnership or agency by acknowledging the possibility but requiring explicit provisions.

original: 21.13  Severability 21.13.1  If any Clause, or part of a  Clause, of this Agreement, is found by any court or administrative body of  competent jurisdiction to be illegal, invalid or unenforceable, and the  provision in question is not of a fundamental nature to the Agreement as a  whole, the legality, validity or enforceability of the remainder of this  Agreement (including the remainder of the Clause or sub Clause which contains  the relevant provision) shall not be affected.
ollama_generated:
21.13a  Modification for Non-essential Provisions - Should any particular Clause, or a segment thereof, within this Agreement, deemed by a court or competent adjudicating body to be incompatible with law, invalid, or non-enforceable, and such contested provision is not vital to the integral structure of this Agreement, then the validity and enforceability of the entire remaining portions of this Agreement (encompassing the rest of the disputed Clause or sub-Clause) shall remain unaffected.

This rewritten clause aims to convey the same meaning as the original one but with a slight tweak in style and word order for a more natural flow, while still maintaining professionalism. The primary difference lies in the way the non-essential nature of the contested provision is emphasized, which may lead to a slightly softer interpretation of its impact on the overall agreement.
